name: unbrilliant
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not very exciting or special: Next to these sophisticated girls, Kate felt hopelessly unbrilliant and untalented. I found this to be a rather unbrilliant play with an equally unbrilliant message.
More examplesFewer examplesFor him, one of the main parts of the community development job was to do "unbrilliant things" -- to put himself out to help other people.Unlike Stoppard, Ayckbourn feasts on the unbrilliant details of daily life.I can understand publishers putting out something unbrilliant out of loyalty to an author, but I can't understand why they would put it up for an award.
